Detailed Description

Writes to a file in the file system.

All write requests made by calling methods in this class are directly forwarded to the equivalent function of the underlying operating system.

The following example demonstrates how to use this FileOutputStream class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {

     // new Content instance
     gaia::core::Context* context = new gaia::core::Context(this);

     gaia::base::String fileName("file.txt");
     gaia::storage::File* file = context->getCacheDirN();
     // Write a file into /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt.
     gaia::storage::FileOutputStream* fos =
         context->openFileOutput(
         fileName, gaia::core::Context::MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE);

     gaia::base::ByteArray buffer(20);
     fos->write(buffer);

     // Ensures that data which is buffered within the underlying
     // implementation is written out to the appropriate device before
     // returning.
     fos->getFDN()->sync();
     fos->close();
 }

See the sample given above. It writes a file into /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt by FileOutputStream.

See also:
FileInputStream

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gaia::storage::FileOutputStream::FileOutputStream ( const File &  file) [explicit]

Constructs a new FileOutputStream that writes to file.

The file will be created if it does not exist.

Parameters:
filethe file to which this stream writes.
gaia::storage::FileOutputStream::FileOutputStream ( const File &  file,
bool  append 
)

Constructs a new FileOutputStream that writes to file.

If append is true and the file already exists, it will be appended to; otherwise it will be truncated. The file will be created if it does not exist.

Parameters:
filethe file to which this stream writes.
appendindicates whether or not to append to an existing file.
gaia::storage::FileOutputStream::FileOutputStream ( const FileDescriptor &  fd) [explicit]

Constructs a new FileOutputStream that writes to fd.

The file must already be open.

Parameters:
fdthe FileDescriptor to which this stream writes.

The file will be created if it does not exist.

void gaia::storage::FileOutputStream::close ( ) [virtual]

Closes this stream.

This implementation closes the underlying operating system resources allocated to represent this stream.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::OutputStream.

a FileDescriptor representing this stream.

void gaia::storage::FileOutputStream::write ( int32_t  oneByte) [virtual]

Writes the specified byte to this stream.

Only the least significant byte of the integer oneByte is written to the stream.

Parameters:
oneBytethe byte to be written.

Implements gaia::storage::OutputStream.

void gaia::storage::FileOutputStream::write ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  count,
int32_t *  err 
)

Writes count bytes from the byte array buffer starting at offset to this stream.

Parameters:
bufferthe buffer to write to this stream.
offsetthe index of the first byte in buffer to write.
countthe number of bytes from buffer to write.
errthe error number. If 0, write successfully. If errno bigger than 0, write failed. You can use the errno to check the reason that the FileOutputStream write fail.
